meanings.definition: The quality of being resistant or obstinate.
meanings.sent1: Her renitency to change made it difficult to introduce new ideas at work.
meanings.sent2: The renitency of the old tree roots made it challenging to dig up the garden.
meanings.sent3: Despite his renitency, the stubborn donkey eventually followed the farmer's lead.
meanings.sent4: The renitency of the waves crashing against the shore symbolized nature's unyielding power.
meanings.sent5: The renitency of the rusty lock kept the treasure chest securely closed.

meanings.definition: The act of resisting or opposing.
meanings.sent1: The renitency of the protestors was met with a strong police presence.
meanings.sent2: Her renitency towards authority figures often got her into trouble.
meanings.sent3: The renitency of the cat to take its medicine turned into a daily struggle.
meanings.sent4: The renitency of the opposing team made the match more challenging and exciting.
meanings.sent5: The renitency of the stubborn door to open added frustration to his morning routine.
